name: Rift Daemons of Lust
background:
The Rift Daemons are monstrous servants of the Havoc Gods, who emerge from beneath the surface of Tyria. Their forms vary greatly, depending on which god they serve, and they are accompanied by a variety of daemonic beasts. 

Daemons serve the strange and alien wills of their gods, emerging from the Great Rift and sewing Havoc throughout Tyria. The Daemons are cast offs of dying gods who desperately hope to buy more time for themselves, ready to leave nothing but havoc in their wake, just in hopes of extending their own lives for a little longer.
backgroundFull:
Rift Daemons are born from the last survivors of a pantheon of dying gods, known to Tyria as the Havoc Gods. Desperate to survive, these gods sought out followers from the lost and desperate, and offered them power in exchange for worship. Those who rejected these gods came to know them as Havoc Gods due to the zealotry of their followers and the unrest that they caused. 

The Havoc Gods came to Tyria soon after Voidgates had been discovered. As mages and adventurers activated Voidgates throughout the land, the influence of Havoc began to spread. The Havoc Gods saw Tyria as a fascinating plane due to the diversity of its peoples, where they could find all sorts of different new followers. 

Daemons were sent into Tyria by their gods, spreading throughout the plane. They sought out followers for their Gods, either through promises of power, or shows of force. They found followers throughout Tyria, whom they guided to conquer others. Treachery, war, and bloodshed became commonplace as the Havoc Wars began. Daemons were seen throughout the continent, fighting alone or alongside mortal allies, as they and their masters threatened to overrun the plane.

The Havoc Gods were on the verge of victory when they fell into a desperate trap set by their enemies. The most powerful mages of Tyria gave their lives in a ritual that managed to seal the Havoc Gods into the Orb of Fate. Suddenly severed from their creators, the forces of Havoc were defeated. The surviving Daemons fled and hid throughout Tyria, escaping wherever they could, while their foes enjoyed an era of peace and prosperity. 

This peace was brought to an abrupt end when, centuries later, the orb was broken by the heirs of the most powerful Human Empire in Tyria. The Havoc Gods were freed, and the power unleashed by the broken orb tore through the heart of Tyria, scarring the land and opening a massive fissure, cutting through much of the plane. This great scar became known as the Rift, and from it, the Daemons began to emerge once more into Tyria. 

The Rift Daemons are eager to return to their masters and avenge their defeat. They have already spread throughout many corners of Tyria, and their hordes grow steadily with each passing day. With their old foes complacent and divided, there are few who can stand against them while they are ready to once more bend Tyria to the will of their gods. 

How will you bring glory to your god?

spells.name: Combat Ecstasy
spells.effect: Pick up to two enemy units within 18", which friendly units gets Quick Shot against once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (this._skirmish ? 1 : this.AuraSize), avgUnit: true }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Beautiful Pain
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 12", which takes 2 hits with Shatter.

spells.name: Blissful Dance
spells.effect: Pick up to four friendly units within 12", which get Melee Evasion once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Total Seizure
spells.effect: Pick up to two enemy models within 18", which take 2 hits with AP(1) each.

spells.name: Lust Boon
spells.effect: Pick up to six friendly units within 12", which get Lustbound Boost once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Overpowering Lash
spells.effect: Pick up to three enemy units within 12", which take 2 hits with AP(1) and Shred each.

specialRules.name: Sergeant
specialRules.description: When this model attacks, unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Unique
specialRules.description: This unit may only be taken once per army.

specialRules.name: Ambush Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Ambush. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Piercing Assault Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Piercing Assault. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Retaliate
specialRules.description: When this model takes a wound in melee, the attacker takes X hits.

specialRules.name: Counter-Attack Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Counter-Attack. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Strider Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Strider. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Hit & Run Fighter Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Hit & Run Fighter. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Surge
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 6 to hit, this weapon deals 1 extra hits (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Storm of Lust
specialRules.description: Once per game, when this model is activated, before attacking, roll 3 dice. For each 2+ one enemy unit within 12" takes 3 hits with Surge (roll one die per hit to see if it triggers).

specialRules.name: Lustbound
specialRules.description: Moves +1" when using Advance, and +3 when using Rush/Charge.

specialRules.name: Quick Shot Mark
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick up to 4 enemy units within 18", which friendly units gets Quick Shot against once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Spawn
specialRules.description: Once per game, when this model is activated, you may place a new unit of X fully within 6" of it.

specialRules.name: Shatter
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and against non-Hero units with Tough(3) or more, this weapon gets AP(+2).

specialRules.name: Unstoppable when Shooting Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Unstoppable when shooting. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Lustbound Boost Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Lustbound Boost. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Ambush
specialRules.description: May be set aside before deployment. At the start of any round after the first, may be deployed anywhere over 9 away from enemy units. Players alternate in placing Ambush units, starting with the player that activates next. Units that deploy via Ambush cant seize or contest objectives on the round they deploy.

specialRules.name: Piercing Assault
specialRules.description: This model gets AP(+1) when charging.

specialRules.name: Counter-Attack
specialRules.description: Strikes first when charged.

specialRules.name: Counter
specialRules.description: Strikes first with this weapon when charged, and the charging unit gets -1 total Impact rolls per model with Counter.

specialRules.name: Strider
specialRules.description: May ignore the effects of difficult terrain when moving, and only needs 2+ to pass jumping rolls.

specialRules.name: Hit & Run
specialRules.description: Once per round, units where all models have this rule may move by up to 3" after shooting or being in melee.

specialRules.name: Hit & Run Fighter
specialRules.description: Once per round, units where all models have this rule may move by up to 3" after being in melee.

specialRules.name: Quick
specialRules.description: Moves +2" when using Advance, and +2 when using Rush/Charge.

specialRules.name: Quick Shot
specialRules.description: This model may shoot after using Rush actions.

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Regeneration
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 5+ it is ignored.

specialRules.name: Ignores Regeneration
specialRules.description: This weapon ignores Regeneration.

specialRules.name: Tough
specialRules.description: This model only rolls to check wound effects once it has taken at least X wounds, and is only Knocked Out on rolls of 5+X or more.

specialRules.name: Unstoppable
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and ignores all negative modifiers to this weapon.

specialRules.name: Lustbound Boost
specialRules.description: If this model has Lustbound, it moves +2" on Advance and +6" on Rush/Charge from Lustbound (instead of only +1" and +3").

specialRules.name: Melee Evasion
specialRules.description: Enemies get -1 to hit rolls in melee when attacking units where all models have this rule.

specialRules.name: Shred
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 1 to block hits, this weapon deals 1 extra wound.
